TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON , a NORP lawyer residing at GPE ( GPE ) , is a member of ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE one of his clients was seriously injured in a road accident near ORG ) .

The applicant was instructed by an insurance company to report on the circumstances of the accident , and on DATE , accompanied by the victim ’s wife , he went to a scrapyard at ORG ( province of PERSON ) where the damaged vehicle had been taken . The client ’s wife having attempted to recover personal property concealed in the petrol tank , the owner of the scrapyard alerted the police , who discovered in her possession inter alia a banknote which formed part of the ransom paid for the release of a person who had been kidnapped . The police thereupon took them to Maratea police station , where they were both questioned , and then put them under arrest , at the disposal of the public prosecutor ( procuratore della PERSON ) . The police also confiscated the items which had been taken from the car .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , Mr PERSON was transferred to FAC ( province of Potenza ) and imprisoned in an isolation cell which he shared with another detainee . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor informed Mr PERSON ’s lawyer that he would hear the applicant on DATE , within DATE laid down by LAW in force at the time .

Mr PERSON appeared on that date , assisted by CARDINAL lawyers . After questioning him , the deputy public prosecutor confirmed his detention ( convalidó PERSON ) . He was returned to PERSON ; he was no longer held in the isolation section , however , but associated with the other prisoners .

CARDINAL . The PERSON public prosecutor conducted the preliminary investigation ( istruzione sommaria ) . On DATE he heard Mr PERSON again , at the latter ’s request , and checked his statements with ORG . On DATE he received a telex from the GPE public prosecutor confirming the provenance of CARDINAL of the banknotes which had been seized . He also revoked the permission which Mr PERSON had been given to consult his lawyers , communicate with other persons and receive visits in prison , in particular from his sister who had travelled from GPE for this purpose .

The applicant ’s lawyers had in the meantime attempted to challenge his continued detention , but in vain : as the public prosecutor ’s office at Lagonegro had declined jurisdiction and that at PERSON was not yet in possession of the necessary documents , ORG was not empowered to deal with the matter ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor issued a warrant for Mr PERSON ’s arrest ( ordine de cattura ) for possession of property and money originating from a ransom . He ordered him to be transferred to FAC .
CARDINAL . The applicant was informed of this decision on DATE , and was taken there in a prison van in TIME of DATE , in handcuffs .

CARDINAL . LAW in force at the time included the following provisions :
A police officer who arrests a person or receives an arrested person must inform the public prosecutor ... thereof immediately , and in any event within TIME ...
He must also notify him of the results of his inquiries within TIME .

The public prosecutor ... must immediately question the arrested person and , if he considers the arrest to be well - founded , confirm the arrest ( convalida ) by a reasoned decision , at the latest within TIME following the above - mentioned notification . This order shall be notified to the arrested person .

" In the cases specified in Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ( flagrante delicto ) the public prosecutor ... may order the arrest . If the arrest warrant is oral , it must be confirmed as soon as possible in writing in the usual form . "

" Police officers who have without an order or warrant from the judicial authorities arrested a person or received a person who has been arrested ... must within TIME place him at the disposal of the public prosecutor or magistrate ... unless the prosecutor and magistrate have been informed of the arrest and consider an extension of the aforesaid time - limit to be necessary . The record of the arrest shall also be notified to the public prosecutor or magistrate .

If he does not have to order the accused ’s release ... the public prosecutor or magistrate shall by a reasoned decision order the accused to be kept in detention at the disposal of the competent authorities ...
CARDINAL . The new Code of Criminal Procedure , which came into force on DATE , no longer authorises the public prosecutor to order detention .
